references: A. E. Jolliffe, Continued Fractions, in Encyclopaedia Britannica, 11th ed., pp. 30-33; see p. 31.
formula: A024199(n) + A024200(n) = A001147(n) = (2n-1)!! - _Max Alekseyev_, Sep 23 2007.A024199(n)/A024200(n) -> Pi/(4-Pi) as n -> oo. - _Max Alekseyev_, Sep 23 2007.E.g.f.: (1-Pi/4)/sqrt(1-2*x) + 1/2*log(2*x+sqrt(4*x^2-1))/sqrt(2*x-1). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 18 2014a(n) ~ (4-Pi) * 2^(n-3/2) * n^n / exp(n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 18 2014
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1-Pi/4)/Sqrt[1-2*x] + 1/2*Log[2*x+Sqrt[4*x^2-1]]/Sqrt[2*x-1], {x, 0, 20}], x] * Range[0, 20]! (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 18 2014 *)RecurrenceTable[{a[n+1] == 2*a[n] + (2*n-1)^2*a[n-1],a[0] == 1, a[1] == 0},a,{n,0,20}] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Mar 18 2014 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
extensions: Revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 19 2002.
Initial terms changed by _Max Alekseyev_, Sep 23 2007.
